intro: Marrubium pseudoalyssum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved horehound, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. It has medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its purported health benefits. The leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and the plant is generally short-lived, often surviving for only a few years.
